1.24.text: I think a lot of people are surprised

3.19.text: thinking, "I didn't know you did that".

5.83.text: And then they say "Oh that's really really good" and "how long have you been

11.71.text: As long as I enjoy it

13.00.text: She's absolutely happy I go out and do what I do

16.66.text: I just thought, if I don't do it now, I never will

19.91.text: I thought this would be a way to, you know

22.55.text: fulfil my passion of what I wanted to do

24.77.text: and still be doing the catering.

26.49.text: What do I get out of it?

32.62.text: Could you hurry up please? Table 6 are waiting . .

34.88.text: Yeah, I've got a full time job - 40 hours plus per week

38.81.text: I do find time for the Specials because

42.39.text: I've been married for 27 years and I've got a 14 year old

45.35.text: so I manage my Special volunteering time around my family.

48.29.text: I feel like a child - especially when you're in the car and they put the blue lights on.

51.60.text: you're like 'Yes' come on I really wanna go

53.70.text: We need all sorts of people with all sorts of personalities.

56.68.text: I mean if we were all like me we'd all be driving each other nuts.

59.29.text: for me it's definitely another life because

61.74.text: some of the things that we do is amazing.

64.00.text: My mum said 'Oh - what about becoming a police officer?"

67.09.text: and I sort of laughed at her and I said

69.35.text: You're joking right? Look at me I like my hair, I like my nails

71.68.text: my make-up - I'm girly and she said

77.98.text: "Why don't you go along to it, have a look and see what it's all about."

80.84.text: We are Special constables who have the same powers as regular officers.

85.27.text: and we are committed to the job.

87.04.text: I'm proud of what I do and I am a serving officer.

92.68.text: We volunteer for the Essex Police Special Constabulary

95.41.text: Finding time within our busy lives to serve our communities and make a difference.

103.29.text: To find out how, visit our website
